thread.title: How Exchange Bigwig Duffy Returned to Deal Making With Cross-Atlantic Bid

author: Alexander Osipovich
title: How Exchange Bigwig Duffy Returned to Deal Making With Cross-Atlantic Bid
text:
Terrence Duffy spearheaded a series of deals that turned CME Group Inc. into the world’s biggest exchange operator. On Thursday, the chairman and chief executive showed he’s still in the game with a $5.4-billion agreement to acquire the U.K.’s NEX Group PLC.
The deal is poised to strengthen CME’s dominance in the exchange business, which has become increasingly consolidated in recent years. The company’s market capitalization is $53.7 billion, while its next-biggest rival, Intercontinental Exchange Inc., is worth $41.7 billion.
